newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: PRESS DIGEST - CZECH REPUBLIC - JUNE 3.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - CZECH REPUBLIC - JUNE 3.

text.p: HOSPODARSKE NOVINY - President Vaclav Havel appointed new ministers to the Czech cabinet yesterday -- Karel Kuhnl as Industry and Trade Minister and Jiri Grusa as Education Minister. Ivan Pilip, the new Finance Minister did not need to be appointed, because he is already a member of the cabinet.

- From the beginning of June, the European Commission of the EU introduced a temporary antidumping customs charge against Czech exporters of seamless pipes -- Nova Hut, Vitkovice and Valcovny Trub Chomutov.
- During May the government budget deficit increased by 200 million crowns to reach 12.2 billion crowns.
- From yesterday, Konsolidacni Banka increased its target interest rate for credits to 25 percent.

- Skoda Praha a.s., Skodaexport a.s. and Egyptian Kahromika signed a contract yesterday with the Egyptian Energy Ministry worth 1.25 billion crowns for the supply of mechanical parts and piping systems for the Ayoun power plant in Egypt.
- According to the South African General George Lodewyga, the South African Army is considering purchasing L-159 fighter aircrafts from Aero Vodochody.

MLADA FRONTA DNES - Prime Minister Vaclav Klaus yesterday reacted to remarks made on Sunday by Deputy Prime Minister Josef Lux that Klaus was hiding a critical IMF analysis of the Czech economy from the cabinet. Klaus said, "The ink has not even dried on the agreement signed by coalition chairmen calling for a new form of cooperation and confidence."
- President Vaclav Havel will fly to Poland today, where he and the presidents of Lithuania, Hungary, Germany, Poland and Slovakia will meet with Pope John Paul II.

- Owners of Poldi Steel and Poldi's bankruptcy administrator Tomas Pelikan agreed yesterday that partial operation in Poldi will be renewed by the consortium of Poldi Steel and Trinecke Zelezarny, most probably in September.
- Shareholders of Zivnostenska Banka approved net profits for last year of 378 million crowns and dividends of 160 crowns per share.
- During a meeting yesterday of experts from Czech and Slovak Agriculture Ministries, Slovakia tried again to restrict imports of beer from the Czech Republic.

LIDOVE NOVINY - During trading yesterday, the crown weakened slightly to nearly 10 percent below its former central parity from 8.70 percent below on Friday. The central bank decreased its repo rate from 75 to 45 percent.
- Minority shareholders of Agrobanka reject the central bank's plan for resolving the bank's crisis situation, which is to divide the bank into two parts and sell the healthy part.
- According to the Czech Statistical Bureau, consumer prices of food products increased from the beginning of this year until the end of April by 4.7 percent, year-on-year.

PRAVO - According to the Administration for Preserving Economic Competition, the association of large drug distributors did not violate the economic competition law when it announced in the middle of February that it would not supply drugs to hospitals which do not pay for them.
- From today, Komercni Banka will decrease interest rates for its new seven-day and two-week accounts.
- According to Prime Minister Vaclav Klaus, Skoda's exports made up 7.5 percent of all Czech exports in April.
- According to former Industry and Trade Minister Vladimir Dlouhy, one of the causes for the decline in Czech industry between last September and this March was coupon privatisation.
